meanings.definition: To lower in rank or position.
meanings.sent1: The boss decided to demote the employee for not following instructions.
meanings.sent2: If you don't work hard, they might demote you at work.
meanings.sent3: The cat threatened to demote the dog from its favorite spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds seemed to demote the towering tree to a mere sapling.
meanings.sent5: The demotion of the general in the chess game was a strategic move.

meanings.definition: To reduce to a lower grade or rank.
meanings.sent1: The teacher had to demote the student to a lower math class due to poor performance.
meanings.sent2: If you keep misbehaving, the principal might demote you to a lower grade.
meanings.sent3: The chef jokingly threatened to demote the burnt cookies to dog treats.
meanings.sent4: The injury seemed to demote the star player to a benchwarmer.
meanings.sent5: The demotion of the superhero to sidekick was unexpected.

meanings.definition: To relegate to a lower rank or less important position.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to demote the manager to a less important role.
meanings.sent2: If you don't meet the deadline, they might demote you to a less crucial project.
meanings.sent3: The king threatened to demote the jester to a court cleaner for his bad jokes.
meanings.sent4: The injury seemed to demote the star player to a benchwarmer.
meanings.sent5: The demotion of the superhero to sidekick was unexpected.
